top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
Good to know that corporate overlords still trump your every day people.
You knew as soon as Obama was praising the framework it was full of corporate hand outs

I'm cool with the clean energy companies winning this deal. I hate that Medicare won't get to negotiate drug prices. It rankles me to no end that Americans pay more than anyone else in the world **for the exact same drugs** because our government is the **only** one that won't negotiate. 

America last. Shit on Americans - subsidize Germans.

I hate that headline. It could’ve read “American Citizens win…”, but since only the Progressives are fighting for us, we get nothing helpful. 

Neoliberalism equals indifference to citizens’ needs when it matters, and if that’s news to you then start paying more attention. Only Progressives are trying to solve problems and help people. In fact, they’re the ones pushing for Biden’s agenda. The centrist neolibs are fighting against it.
